result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Matthew John Sherwood was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: All conditions of probation shall remain the same for extended supervision.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

Cash bond to be applied to outstanding financials.
lf extended supervision is revoked and the defendant will have a mandatory release from prison, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.  
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: Commencing forthwith.  Time shall be served with Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Matthew John Sherwood in court and by Attorney Joseph R. Kennedy. Court finds defendant guilty on Ct. 1 and orders Ct. 2 dismissed and read in.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

Transcript Preliminary and Refusal Hearing 05/24/2022

Prosecuting Attorney Stephanie L. Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew John Sherwood in court and by Attorney Joseph R. Kennedy.  Reading of Information waived.  Not guilty pleas entered.

State's Exhibit 1; Defendant's Exhibit 2 (unscannable)

Prosecuting Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew J. Sherwood in court and by Attorney Joseph R. Kennedy.  Defense requesting preliminary hearing to be scheduled.  Counsel stipulate to proceed with both preliminary hearing and refusal hearing today.  WITNESS:  Deputy Nathaniel Sincoular (WCSD).  Defense requests to play video to refresh officer's recollection.  No objection from the State.  Defense counsel requests audio be taken by court reporter.  Audio of video played by defense.  Video/audio played at defense table for officer to view.  WITNESS:  Deputy Nathaniel Sincoular (WCSD) continued.  Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  State to file an Information.  Arraignment scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Hearing on June 15, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Per request of Atty. Kennedy and upon no objection from Atty. Nugent, 5-18-2022 hearing rescheduled to 5-24-2022 at 2:30 p.m.

Prosecuting Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew John Sherwood in court without counsel.  Defendant states his attorney is not present and he has retained Atty. Joseph Kennedy.  Case passed to allow defendant to contact Atty. Kennedy.  Case recalled.  Per defendant, counsel calendared the wrong date.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with counsel.
